title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
Have a 820-2936 with no liquid or drop damage. When turned on the screen just changes solid full screen colors from red, green, blue, gray e.t.c

Could this be BIOS, PCH, or SMC issue?  Never seen this problem before

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
LCD went in test mode.
Try few times PRAM reset first.
If no change, test with known good screen.

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
pram reset had no change.

with known good lcd the screen boots up white like normal but no apple logo with hard drive installed and no question mark folder ever appears without hard drive plugged in, just a blank white screen

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: do you have question folder on external??? Voltages on J9000 pins 2 and 4??

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
"Pure" white usually means no 3V for TFT matrix; check for 3V at pins 2/3 of J9000.
Also check external video, as above mentioned...

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
pin 2 3.242 V

pin 3 3.240V

nothing on external with board running for 5 minutes

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: no question mark or activity of any type on external

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
Try external monitor with internal LCD disconnected.
Do you get chime?
Can you confirm USB activity?

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
I get chime with or without internal lcd however i only get question mark folder on external monitor. I get chime with or without external

Yes I have usb activity

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
If connect original LCD assembly color test comes back?
Check continuity for all LVDS data lines of J9000.
Pay atention to L9080...

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
board is in perfect shape with no drop or liquid damage, not sure how this could be a continuity problem.

Replaced L9080 L9004 and U9000 and still no question mark on good test lcd. Original screen is still going into test mode.

what else can I try?

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: Try BIOS, just in case...

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: Applied some heat to PCH and now its shorted. Will update after its replaced.

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: Don't forget, new PCH requires clean ME region in BIOS!

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
Just before I changed PCH checked for short one last time and it was gone somehow so tried new bios with new ME region. Now it chimes but cant get original lcd or test lcd to work.

Anything else to try or check or should PCH be replaced next?

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: pins 2 and 3 on J9000 now 0V

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: External video still good?

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: No external video now

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: Bad PCH then...

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
I have replaced PCH twice now and cant get a fan spin again. After first replacement thought maby bad pch or bad soldering since the light on charger came on but no fan spin and only drew .140amps so tried another PCH from donar board. I know my soldering is good but now I have no light and board only drawing 0.35 amps.

what am I missing? Are pads on board damaged beyond repair possibly?

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message: Ye I am using bios with new me region

title: 820-2936 screen changing colors
message:
You must check Power On Sequence now.
If only touched PCH, should be bad chip, broken solders, or some surrounding component moved.
Post some basic signals/voltages...
